title: Issue with clingo concretizer
body:
I get an error when trying to use the new clingo concretizer with an invalid keyword argument.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack spec python # same issue trying to get any spec 
```

### Error Message
```console
$ spack -d --stacktrace spec python
lib/spack/spack/cmd/__init__.py:122 ==> [2020-11-21-18:02:36.921608] Imported spec from built-in commands
lib/spack/spack/cmd/__init__.py:122 ==> [2020-11-21-18:02:36.922823] Imported spec from built-in commands
Input spec
--------------------------------
python

Concretized
--------------------------------
lib/spack/spack/config.py:907 ==> [2020-11-21-18:02:36.930440] Reading config file /home/mersoj/spack/etc/spack/defaults/config.yaml
lib/spack/spack/config.py:907 ==> [2020-11-21-18:02:36.962138] Reading config file /home/mersoj/.spack/config.yaml
lib/spack/spack/config.py:907 ==> [2020-11-21-18:02:36.972896] Reading config file /home/mersoj/spack/etc/spack/defaults/repos.yaml
lib/spack/spack/config.py:907 ==> [2020-11-21-18:02:37.231508] Reading config file /home/mersoj/.spack/linux/compilers.yaml
lib/spack/spack/config.py:907 ==> [2020-11-21-18:02:37.247611] Reading config file /home/mersoj/spack/etc/spack/defaults/packages.yaml
lib/spack/spack/config.py:907 ==> [2020-11-21-18:02:37.282880] Reading config file /home/mersoj/.spack/packages.yaml
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/mersoj/spack/bin/spack", line 66, in <module>
    sys.exit(spack.main.main())
  File "/home/mersoj/spack/lib/spack/spack/main.py", line 762, in main
    return _invoke_command(command, parser, args, unknown)
  File "/home/mersoj/spack/lib/spack/spack/main.py", line 490, in _invoke_command
    return_val = command(parser, args)
  File "/home/mersoj/spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/spec.py", line 102, in spec
    spec.concretize()
  File "/home/mersoj/spack/lib/spack/spack/spec.py", line 2469, in concretize
    self._new_concretize(tests)
  File "/home/mersoj/spack/lib/spack/spack/spec.py", line 2445, in _new_concretize
    result = spack.solver.asp.solve([self], tests=tests)
  File "/home/mersoj/spack/lib/spack/spack/solver/asp.py", line 1838, in solve
    return driver.solve(setup, specs, dump, models, timers, stats, tests)
  File "/home/mersoj/spack/lib/spack/spack/solver/asp.py", line 643, in solve
    solve_result = self.control.solve(
TypeError: 'on_core' is an invalid keyword argument for this function
```

### Information on your system
* **Spack:** 0.16.0-32-4609a126b
* **Python:** 3.8.5
* **Platform:** linux-ubuntu20.04-broadwell
* **Concretizer:** clingo

```console
$ clingo --version
clingo version 5.4.0
Address model: 64-bit

libclingo version 5.4.0
Configuration: with Python 3.8.5, without Lua

libclasp version 3.3.5 (libpotassco version 1.1.0)
Configuration: WITH_THREADS=1
Copyright (C) Benjamin Kaufmann

License: The MIT License <https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT>
```

### Additional information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [x] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output
